content.question: Solutions to the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> also satisfy <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4673@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = f(x) be a particular solution to the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with f(1) = 2. (a) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of y = f(x) at x = 1.

frqParts.text: Solutions to the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> also satisfy <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>d</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>+</mo> <mn>3</mn> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@4673@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Let y = f(x) be a particular solution to the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mi>x</mi> <msup> <mi>y</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msup> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3DBC@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with f(1) = 2. (a) Write an equation for the line tangent to the graph of y = f(x) at x = 1.
(b) Use the tangent line equation from part (a) to approximate f(1.1). Given that f(x) > 0 for 1 < x < 1.1, is the approximation for f(1.1) greater than or less than f(1.1)? Explain your reasoning.
(c) Find the particular solution y = f(x) with initial condition f(1) = 2.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
